title: Did Cities Close Schools, Businesses During the 1918 Pandemic?
subtitle: The year 2020 was not the first time public places were ordered closed to prevent the spread of a disease.
author: Dan Evon
vclaim: A newspaper clipping from 1918 documents a "public notice" from the city of Kelowna, British Columbia, announcing that schools, movie theaters, and other public places would be closed to prevent the spread of "Spanish Influenza."
